channel.title: OnOptions
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from OnOptions, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Architects just remade Donald Judd’s iconic Marfa office for the climate change age
item.description: Good news for Donald Judd fans: The renovation of his Marfa, Texas, architecture office is now complete. The two-story brick building built in 1907 lo...

item.title: When to swerve, when to pivot, and how to tell the difference
item.description: When Stephanie Downs, cofounder of Uncaged Innovations, a biomaterials startup creating alternatives to animal leathers, learned about the tariffs ear...

item.title: This is why most workplace training programs fail
item.description: A client once confessed, “At least half of every training dollar we spend is wasted—we just don’t know which half.” This is a sobering reality. In 202...

item.title: Exclusive: Fintech startup Ramp hits $1 billion in annualized revenue after notching $22.5 billion valuation
item.description: The six-year-old company is rebuilding corporate credit cards and expense reports with funding from Founders Fund, Iconiq, and Khosla Ventures.

item.title: Tennis champion Coco Gauff loves this $2 monthly subscription, cooks TikTok recipes, and treats herself with $3,000 shopping sprees
item.description: 21-year-old star athlete Coco Gauff has been breaking tennis records for years—but the multimillionaire doesn’t pay for her own Netflix, shops second-...

item.title: The simple reason a DIY burrito kit could help Chipotle sell more burritos
item.description: Chipotle would like to be invited over for dinner. The Newport Beach, California-based fast-casual chain is going DIY mode with “Build-Your-Own Chipot...

item.title: Ray Dalio says ‘most people are silent’ because they’re afraid to talk about what’s really happening with the U.S. economy
item.description: Bridgewater's billionaire founder sees dangerous 1930s parallels as government intervention increases and debt reaches World War II levels.

item.title: Moody’s Chief Economist Says the U.S. Is ‘on the Precipice’ of a Recession
item.description: The biggest litmus test for the state of the economy is coming this Friday, says Mark Zandi.

item.title: Psychology Says ‘Skillcactions’ Are the Most Refreshing Vacations
item.description: I just got back from a beach vacation and still feel beat. Psychologists suggest I should have tried a skillcation instead.

item.title: MIT scientists may have just cracked the code on EV battery recycling
item.description: This year, global EV sales are expected to jump almost 25% compared with 2024. As the demand for electric vehicles soars, there’s a looming concern fo...

item.title: Starbucks hops on the health craze with protein coffee weight-loss influencers had been concocting in its drive thru for months
item.description: Protein lattes and cold foam will roll out in U.S. and Canada stores starting Sept. 29, the company announced this week.

item.title: The Labor Market Is Making a Clear Case for Fed Rate Cuts
item.description: The S&P 500 has rebounded 27 percent from its April lows.

item.title: How ŌURA Got Caught in a TikTok Conspiracy Storm
item.description: The viral outrage over ŌURA’s government contract has taken on a life of its own. Here’s what actually happened.

item.title: Amazon Is Ending a Beloved Prime Shipping Benefit. Here’s What Will Change on October 1
item.description: The Seattle e-commerce giant is tightening its rules for benefits sharing, taking a cue from fellow subscription services such as Netflix and Disney.

item.title: The price of gold could hit $5,000 if Trump keeps meddling with the Fed, Goldman Sachs says
item.description: "Gold is a store of value that doesn’t rely on institutional trust,” Samantha Dart says.
